title: As BOC, I want to see a player's service days with his current club
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the MJ Service Batch
custom_expected:
THEN Player's current club MLS is the player's MLS with the Org that is he currently associated with shown in the XX.YYY format.
AND If player was with the same ORG from previous seasons, then this value is the current season service added to the previous season service with that same Org.
AND Updated value should show on the Player profile service tab

title: As BOC, I only want service calculations to start after Roster Submission time on Opening Day
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is running the MJ Service Batch
custom_steps: WHEN calculating service for Opening Day
custom_expected:
THEN the system should only begin to check for Service accruing roster statuses after "Opening Day Roster submission deadline" time (set in System dates) 
AND if player had a service accruing roster status before the submission time but did not have a service roster status after the submission time, player does not get service for that day
AND To get the time of the transaction, use the time of submission/approval (to be checked in ebis 1)

title: As BOC, I can see a day by day breakdown of player's MJ service
custom_steps: WHEN user runs the MJ Services Batch
custom_expected:
THEN For all players affected by the MJ service batch, on the Service tab of the player profile, add the section "Breakdown" as per wireframe: http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=service
AND The year dropdown is set to current year. We will only start keeping breakdown history from the year Ebis 2.5 goes live
AND Do now show "Type of Service" filter dropdown as this will not be implemented before go-live
AND Table is not editable

AND Show table with following columns (other columns implemented later and should not be added to page)
- Date - Show a row for every date starting from Opening day to Last day of season. Most recent on top
- MJ Roster Status EOD - MJ Roster status for the player at the end of each of those days
- Org EOD - Org of player at end of each date
- MJ service - Check mark if player got service that day.  Blank otherwise
- MJ Day - Start count of service day so 1st day of service would be 1, 2nd day is 2 etc.

title: As BOC, I want Major League service to be given to player automatically every night
custom_steps: WHEN a player qualifies for service for the upcoming day based on his current Major league roster status
custom_expected: THEN tick up his MJ service automatically after midnight

title: As BOC, I want to manually adjust service calculation by adding or removing service days
custom_steps: WHEN user is logged in as BOC and viewing the service tab on a player profile
custom_expected:
THEN there is an Edit button to this page. 
AND When user hits edit, the "Adjustments" column and 'Comments column of the Major League Summary section become editable
AND The Adjustments column only accepts number values - both positive and negative
AND Adjustments can be entered for any row
AND On hitting save, for the altered rows, the 'Days toward 172' and 'Total Season Service' are updated to account for adjustments which can be addition or subtraction. However, the total can never exceed 172
AND The total MLS for the altered year and every subsequent year should get recalculated to show the adjusted Total MLS
AND Appropriate fields in the Service Info Section should also get updated with the new MLS

AND global AC are followed:
- Floaty button functionality should work
- Once page is in edit mode, the save and cancel button appear
- Cancel reverts to view mode without saving changes
- Comments should follow global guidelines similar to how it works on Attached files

title: As BOC, I want to manually add a year to MJ Summary
custom_preconds: GIVEN that BOC is viewing the stats tab on a player profile
custom_steps: WHEN the page is in EDIT mode
custom_expected:
THEN the MJ Summary has an 'Add Row' option
AND When a row is added, the Year, Club, Days w Club, Adjustments and Comments columns become editable. Other columns stay uneditable
AND The year dropdown only let's you select a year starting from 2004 up until the year of the last or current season. Additionally only show years that do not already have a row in the table. If the player already has a row for every year since 2004 until now, then the dropdown is blank.
AND User can select the Org and enter a number value for Days w Club and Adjustments. 
AND On Saving, treat the newly added row just like any other historical service record and adjust the service calculation accordingly. Also rearrange the newly added row chronologically
AND Note that if a manual record was entered for the current year, and if the service batch finds that he has service for the current year, the manual record can be overwritten by the service batch.

title: As BOC, I want the MJ Service batch to automatically account for Adjustments
custom_steps: WHEN the MJ Service batch is run
custom_expected: THEN batch should account for manual adjustments made to the player before displaying the updated Service calculations

title: As BOC, I want the current year MJ service summary to get updated daily
custom_steps: WHEN the MJ Service Batch is run
custom_expected:
THEN Populate the Major League summary table with the most current information for current season rows when the service batch is run
AND If player has switched Orgs, each Org gets it's own row for that year
AND "Days with Club" is the total # of days player spent with the club irrespective of whether he got service or not. If a player was traded, the "To" club gets service credit for that day
AND 'Days toward 172' is how many days with this club counted towards service upto a max of 172
AND Total Season service is the total # of service days this season irrespective of Org. Only the row for his most recent Org is populated.
AND Total MLS is his total current MLS for this current season. For rows with previous Orgs, populate with the MLS that the player left the Org with

title: As BOC, I want to calculate Option days for a player
custom_steps: WHEN user views the Batch tab under System Admin
custom_expected:
THEN there is a new batch under Service called "Option / Outright Days"
AND Similar to the MJ service batch, it has a parameter for player ID. 
AND It can be run in report mode, test mode and update mode
AND Batch always recalculates from the beginning of the season
AND Player population is the same as MJ Service batch


AND If player's MJ Roster status is 'Optioned' at any point during the day, that day counts as an Option day
AND Keep track of how many total Option days the player had in the current season. If player is currently on Option, count the # of days in his current assignment
AND Populate the "Option Day" column on the 'Breakdown' section of a player's service page. This should count up similar to 'MJ Day' column
AND Update the 'Option Days - Current Season' and 'Option Days - Current Assignment' fields on the transaction tab.

AND the results table has the following columns:
Player ID
Player Name
Current Org
Current Club
MJ Roster Status
MN Roster Status
Option Days
Outright Days

AND the following global AC are followed:
- Batch can be aborted
- Show progress bar when processing
- Any errors are returned in results
- Previous batch results can be viewed
- Batch can be run in Test mode where the batch changes can be reversed
- Batch can be run in Update mode where they are actually changed

title: As BOC, I want to track Outright days for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN logged in as club or BOC
custom_steps: WHEN Major/Minor Outright has been approved for player
custom_expected:
THEN we start counting outright days from the date of the transaction
AND The only roster status that is valid for earning an outright day is a null/blank major league roster status
AND Outright Days will stop reset to zero once a player re–joins a major league club, or the end of the season is reached. 
AND The day he gains a Major league roster status does not count toward an Outright day.
AND if player has an Major/Minor Outright with “Post Game Assignment” checkbox checked, then he does not get an Outright day for the date of the transaction
AND "Outright Days - Current Assignment" field is populated with the updated value
AND the "Outright Day" column populates on the 'Breakdown' section of a player's service page. (This should count up similar to 'MJ Day' column)

title: As BOC, I want to calculate a player's Minor League service days
custom_steps: WHEN user views a breakdown of an MN player's service
custom_expected:
**AC**
THEN for each day of the season, including the first and last day, if the player had a roster accruing minor league status at any point during the day, he gets one day of MN service.

**Roster Accruing statuses**
7DL - 7 Day DL
7RH - Rehab 7 Day DL
60D - 60 Day DL
60R - Rehab 60 Day DL
ACT - Active
TI - Temporarily Inactive

AND
- Each minor league club has it's own start date and end date in the Club system dates screen. Use the player's MN club at EOD for each day to determine if that day is in season or not. Do not include post season. 
- If player was in multiple MN clubs on the same day, the credit goes to the last MN club that he finished with.
- If player already got Major league service for that day, then player cannot get Minor league service for the same day.
- Update the "Current Season Service" field under the Minor League Service section of the Service tab
- Update the current year row in the Minor League Summary table in the Service tab
